channel.title: Electric timer
channel.description:
Is there something (preferably cheap, don't see why it wouldn't be) that can turn something on and off at certain intervals?
For a wall socket.
Like I could plug something into it, and plug it into the wall, and pick 12 and then every 12 hours it turns the power on or off.
I don't need a ton of options like different intervals. Just a simple one like set it from 0 - 24 and if I pick 16, every 16 hours it turns off and then on on the next 16th hour.

item.title: Electric timer
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Any of these? http://www.nextag.com/intermatic-switch-timer-wall/search-html

Read full topic

item.title: Electric timer
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Cool. Thanks.
I was looking around for them and I could only find expensive ones with multiple outlets and too many settings.

I just need one that will do something every set amount of hours. Not like I set it for 12 and in 12 hours it turns off. Like every 12 hours it rotates.

Not much information in that one but I’ll check it out in store and ask about them and see if that one will work since it is also the cheapest so far.

Read full topic

item.title: Electric timer
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

Yes, they make them to turn lamps on at certain times to make it seem like there is someone home (fool robbers)

http://www.homedepot.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/ProductDisplay?storeId=10051&langId=-1&catalogId=10053&productId=100652847
